CropRotationViz 0.1.0
  • Reference

Crop Sequence Builder Interface

Source: R/sequencer.R
sequencer_ui.Rd

Creates an interactive Shiny UI for analyzing and managing agricultural crop rotation sequences across multiple years. The interface facilitates spatial data analysis, crop pattern visualization, and sequence generation with support for various data formats and processing options.

sequencer_ui(app_data, output_dir = NA, start_year = NA, vector_file = TRUE)

Arguments

app_data

List containing application configuration and reference data:

  • Input_App_dataList containing:

    • codierung_allData frame with crop coding references

    • crop_codesVector of valid crop identification codes

    • display_namesMapping of codes to display names

output_dir

Character string specifying the default output directory path. Default: NA

start_year

Numeric value indicating the initial year for sequence analysis. Default: NA

vector_file

logical. If True (default) you will get a vector file as an additional output with all intersected and aggregated field data.

Value

A Shiny UI definition (fluidPage) containing the complete sequence builder interface

Details

Crop Sequence Builder UI Component

The interface provides a comprehensive set of tools for crop rotation analysis:

  • Data Input

    • Support for multiple spatial file formats (.shp, .geojson, .fgb, .gpkg, .sqlite)

    • Upload capability for up to 10 years of spatial data

    • Dynamic column selection for crop identification

  • Processing Options

    • Choice between NC (National Coding) or Name-based crop identification

    • Optional crop class aggregation for NC-based analysis

    • Selection between fast and complete field intersection methods

  • Visualization

    • Interactive map preview of loaded spatial data

    • Summary display of loaded files and their properties

  • Output

    • Multiple export format options (Shapefile, GeoPackage, FlatGeobuf)

    • Customizable output directory selection

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Initialize with default settings
ui <- sequencer_ui(app_data)

# Initialize with specific output directory and start year
ui <- sequencer_ui(
  app_data,
  output_dir = "path/to/output",
  start_year = 2020
)
} # }
